There are lots of arguments “for” Laissez Faire” capitalism. There is no shortage in that regard. The problem is that every single argument in favor of laissez faire, is utter, unadulterated, hogwash! What laissez faire means is: “unregulated capitalism” Think about that and let it sink in. We know that capitalists are motivated by nothing other than their own, personal, unmitigated, greed. The premise therefore of laissez faire is that this greed will ultimately bring about economic justice and prosperity, where all regulation fails to do so. John Maynard Keynes had a thought on that point:  The bottom line is that it is absolutely preposterous to believe that repealing regulations and oversight will somehow produce better results than properly regulated economies will achieve. It is sort of like saying that the best way to safeguard the money in the bank, is to leave the vault open and disable the lock on the front door. Where people get ideas like this is a mystery, but the fact that some folks believe this nonsense is frightening as well as astounding. Here is the truth. In the absence of regulation and oversight, hopefully by a government that is actually a democracy, representing The People, the greed and corruption inherent in capitalism will as a matter of practical reality, make the rules. And those rules will favor the corporations and the wealthy, while the rest of us get poorer and poorer every day. Which is sort of what is happening right now in the US, come to think of it. There are no magical “markets” that distribute wealth based on some universal and naturally occurring concept of merit. This magical thing just simply doesn’t exist. If you regard the capitalist mythology with the same level of skepticism you would use if I were to tell you that a spaceship from Neptune had just landed in my backyard, you would realize that laissez faire capitalism is just a fraud and a con, designed to separate fools from their money.
